ygData.subject: Re: Visibility of CrawlScope Logger
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I was thinking of, that I always have to use the same instance of Logger, isn t it? That s the reason why I would like to access this static variable. If

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "stack@a..." <stack@a...> wrote:
> hc696_9 wrote:
> 
> > Can you please change the visibility of Logger in Class
> > org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlScope from:
> > "static final Logger logger =
> > Logger.getLogger(CrawlScope.class.getName());"
> > back to
> > "protected static final Logger logger =
> > Logger.getLogger(CrawlScope.class.getName());"
> >
> > otherwise it's not possible to access it from other packages. Sorry,
> > I'm not one of your developers and can't update this change to your
> > CVS.
> >
> > Thanks, Adrian
> >
> What if I added an accessor instead?
> 
> Is there a reason why you do not want to add a logger to your subclass?
> 
> Yours,
> St.Ack
> 

I was thinking of, that I always have to use the same instance of
Logger, isn't it? That's the reason why I would like to access this
static variable. If not, I can't find a reason why I shouldn't add a
logger to my subclass.
